Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: இகலென்னும் எவ்வநோய் நீக்கின் தவலில்லாத் தாவில் விளக்கம் தரும்.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: If enmity, that grievous plague, you shun, Endless undying praises shall be won.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A person is shown physically removing and casting away a dark, sickly cloak that represents the 'grievous disease' of hostility ('இகல் என்னும் எவ்வநோய்').
Layered_Composition.Midground: The moment the cloak is removed, a brilliant, eternal, and unfailing light of glory and fame ('தவலில்லாத் தாவில் விளக்கம்') bursts forth from the person, illuminating everything around them.
Layered_Composition.Background: This light is shown to be indestructible and permanent, representing the lasting praise one earns by ridding oneself of hostility.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: Removing the grievous disease of hostility will bestow upon a person an unfailing and indestructible light of glory.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The dark, sickly cloak is hostility. The act of removing it is the virtuous choice. The resulting burst of eternal, unfailing light is the reward of lasting fame.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: The scene transforms from dark and sickly to brilliantly illuminated. The light of glory is a powerful, pure, white-gold that is clearly permanent.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A dynamic shot that captures the moment the cloak is cast off and the light of glory erupts.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, cinematic, with powerful volumetric lighting and particle effects.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: The primary light source is the person's own newfound glory.
Technical_Cues.Art_Genre: High-fantasy art, with a strong spiritual theme.

Cultural_Anchors: Removing the disease of hostility ('இகல் என்னும் எவ்வநோய் நீக்கின்')
Receiving unfailing, indestructible light/glory ('தவலில்லாத் தாவில் விளக்கம்')
